Cranes number/capacity/type:

4 / 30 MT without Grab / 25MT with Grab / TTS Bohai Machinery - Electro-Hydraulic Cranes

Grabs number/capacity/type:

4 x 12 CBM / Electro-Hydraulic Dual Scoop

 

NOTE: Grabs not to be used unless specific agreement has been made with owners

Speed and Consumption

 

Speed / Consumption:

Abt. 11.8 knots laden on abt 26.0 mt and abt 0.10 mt MGO DMA max 0.10% Sulphur

Abt 12.5 knots ballast on abt 26.0 mt and abt 0.10 mt MGO DMA max 0.10% Sulphur

 

Under good weather conditions up to Beaufort 4 and total combined (sea and swell) significant wave height confined to limits of Douglas Sea State 3 (0.5 – 1.25 meters) with no adverse currents and at Summer load

In port when idle:

Abt. 3.5 mt IFO RMG380 and abt 0.2 mt MGO DMA max 0.10% Sulphur

In port when working:

Abt. 4.5 mt IFO RMG380 and abt 0.2 mt MGO DMA max 0.10% Sulphur

Vessel is allowed to consume MGO (max 0.10% Sulphur) when starting/stopping and maneuvering in narrow/shallow water - Yes

Bunkers on board always to comply with: ISO8217: 2005(e) or any latest amendments / IFO: RMG380 or better MDO: DMB or better

ULSFO: as per ISO8217: 2010 (e) RMD-80, RME- 180 or better / VLSFO: as per ISO8217: 2010 (e) RME- 180, RMG-380 or better, Sulphur content up to 0.5% m/m.

Loa/Beam:

189.99 m / 32.26 m

International GT/NT:

32,987.00 / 19,231.00

Panama Canal NT:

27,343.00

Suez Canal GT/NT

34,259.41 / 30,935.84

Bunker tank capacities:

1664.53m3 (HFO), 187.8m3 (LSFO), 223.43m3 (MDO), 293.26m3 (LSMGO) (always to be confirmed by master)

Constants:

Always to be confirmed by Master

Tank Strengths:

Tank Top

Deck

Hatch Cover

 

Holds No1, No3 & No5 =25 MT/sqm Holds No2 and No4 = 20MT/sqm

 

All  2.3 MT/sqm

Cement holes:

Two per hatch cover/ Dia: 700mm. Location:  Fwd.-Port / Aft-Stbd (2m from F / A ends of hatch covers)

Logs stanchions/sockets: No

Electrical ventilation:

Grain Fitted: Yes

Australian hold ladder: Yes

Are holds CO2 fitted:  Yes

 

Strengthened for heavy cargo: Yes

Logs Fitted: No

Holds left empty:

2 and 4

The vessel fitted with the Ballast Water Treatment Plant

The vessel’s description for the stated Max speed is in line with the class-issued Technical File to comply with the EEXI Speed requirements/ EPL Installed.

Charterers shall supply suitable fuel to enable main propulsion and auxiliary machinery to operate efficiently and without harmful effects. The fuel

shall be blend of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum refining. The fuel shall be free from waste lubricants, chemicals, or any other harmful

substances. The Sulphur content of the fuel to be in accordance with prevailing limits when the vessel is trading in designated SECA areas (or other emission-controlled areas).

Fuel always to correspond with the requirements of MARPOL Annex VI and European Union, US and other local regulations in force. MGO/MDO   always to be used at sea in case of low load, emergency and/or navigation with reduced speed and/or in restricted areas like approaches, shallow waters and when manoeuvring in ports/rivers/channels/canals. Use of MDO to be at chief engineer's sole discretion.

Vessel can only handle maximum two grades at any given time.

All information about and believed to be correct.


PLSD TO HEAR.
 
BEST REGARDS,
